rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Dr. Hackney is really not all that bad. He can be snarky at times in class, but he paces the content well for his students. Eight exams seems overbearing at the start. But it has not been too bad, and most of them were online and out of class, so you had flexibility there.  Really nothing too bad, but working very hard is necessary for an A.

Dr. Hackney is seriously the most inequitable man here at UNC. His tests were extremely unfair. The TAs in the class even would say "It's not in the book, it wasn't on the lecture slides but I'm pretty sure he talked about this in class" to which we all disagreed on. There are also 7 exams and a final, which makes for an extremely stressful class.
Nice
I do not like him

This dude's a hack. He's super anal about you using your phone in class and is exceptionally boring, making paying attention nearly impossible. On the last day of class, on the power point he uploaded for notes, he replaced certain slides with, "Slide content presented in class." Avoid this professor if at all possible.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Very good teacher, but due to subject matter (anatomy), you have no choice but memorize LOTS of stuff. On his tests, Dr Padua likes to ask for the location of anatomical items, for ex. "what is the location of the scapula?" (Ans: C2 - T7; don't worry, it'll make sense to you when you take anatomy).

Really good teacher, and interesting subject.  The tests are easy as long as you are able to memorize, no surprising or trick questions.  The lectures can get kind of boring, but not bad.  Beware of TAs though, the days that the TA teaches are awful and I could barely pay attention.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: not helpful248

Dr. B is by far my favorite professor I've ever had at UNC. He draws on his past experiences to provide real world examples and is very hands-on. He truly wants his students to succeed. If you ever have the chance to take a course taught by Dr. B, I would highly recommend doing so.

Excellent professor. Very enjoyable lectures. Dr B draws on his practical experience to make lecture topics more interesting by relating anecdotes, training tips, etc. One of the best classes I've taken in my (very long) college career.
Dr. B is one of the best professors I have had at UNC!
Dr. B is awesome

Wonderful professor, and very helpful! Class is enjoyable and Dr. B provides excellent examples that keeps the subject matter even more interesting. Tests are not too difficult if you put in the time studying. Making A is definitely possible!! He wants his students so succeed.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Best professor there is! Must take her class!
She is a great professor. Knows her stuff. Makes the information easy to understand, but studying is a good idea. I also recommend this course as a Maymester course.
Very good teacher.  Class was easy for the most part.  Tests not hard...just have to know your stuff.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: very easy...keeps you interested

Sports Management with Barbara Osborne Esquire was awesome.  She brings experience (she was an Athletic Director at a University) and enthusiasm.  I'd definitely recommend this class as an easy elective that's also interesting.  NO EXAMS AT ALL!  Only 3 written assignments!  What more could you ask for?
No Comments

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Such a nice guy! Class material is pretty boring but he inserts little jokes in every once and a while to keep you awake. He's a smart guy and very willing to help you with anything you need.

rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: Mr. Hanson was easily the worst professor I have had at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. Consistently, his exam questions had incorrect answers which I pointed out and they were not corrected. Quite frankly, I feel as if I answer a question correctly, I should get the points! Mr. Hanson does not, wish I had more room to elaborate.

Did not enjoy this class. The professor did not keep me engaged at all. Although he made the PowerPoints available, they were not very clear. Therefore, when we had take home tests I sometimes did even worse on them than the in class tests. There were a total of 6 tests, which was nice because each test did not have a large chunk of material.
Extremely unclear lecturer. He does not explain topics well at all, which screws you over for tests.
Reading the textbook is necessary to do well in this class since he makes many topics unclear. He also often takes a while to respond to emails.

Professor Hanson has trouble conveying the concepts to students. This is clear on many exams, where the language and answer choices that Professor Hanson uses confuses many students. Professor Hanson made this class harder and more confusing than it should be.
